txt.en:
'Much has been made clear to me by Tárandil's confession.'

Gandalf leans wearily on his staff.

'The shade of Isildur spoke true. The Disaster of the Gladden Fields was no accident.'
The shade of Tárandil has manifested for a single purpose: he wishes to make his confession.
The shade of Tárandil is by the waggon bearing the bones of Isildur northward.
Gandalf is by the waggon bearing the bones of Isildur northward.
Talk to Gandalf by the waggon in Laerlad
The shade of Isildur stares impassively at Tárandil, and says nothing.
The shade of Isildur stares impassively at Tárandil, and says nothing.
'Tárandil's confession has not yet ended. If he will say more, we must listen.'
'I have more to tell, though it cause me pain. I heed it not, for the wounds run deep; there is no part of me that feels them not.'
Talk to the shade of Tárandil and complete 'Instance: His Father's Son'
'What says Tárandil now? His confession is not complete.'
